intro: Chamaesaracha pallida, commonly known as the pale chamaesaracha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white. Chamaesaracha pallida is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
